Package net.hudup.core.evaluate

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Metric
    In Hudup framework, there are two kinds of result: Recommendation result is represented by the output of method Recommender#estimate(...) or Recommender#recommend(...), which is used for recommendation process.
    MetricValue
    This interface represents value of a metric, called metric value.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractMetric
    This abstract class, called abstract metric, implements partially Metric interface.
    Accuracy
    Currently, two default metrics inherited from DefaultMetric class are TimeMetric class and Accuracy class.
    ArrayMetricValue
    This abstract class represents an array of real numbers as a MetricValue.
    ClassificationAccuracy
    Currently, two default metrics inherited from DefaultMetric class are TimeMetric class and Accuracy class.
    CorrelationAccuracy
    Currently, two default metrics inherited from DefaultMetric class are TimeMetric class and Accuracy class.
    CosineTwoArrayMetricValue
    This abstract class represents a cosine of two arrays of real numbers (cosine of two real vectors) as a MetricValue.
    DefaultMetric
    Note, the abstract class of Metric interface is {code AbstractMetric}.
    FractionMetricValue
    This abstract class represents fraction (a/b) as a MetricValue.
    MeanMetricValue
    This abstract class represents a average number called mean in form (total sum / count) as a MetricValue.
    MonoMetricValue
    This abstract class represents a single number as a MetricValue.
    PearsonTwoArrayMetricValue
    This abstract class represents a Pearson coefficient (correlation coefficient) of two arrays of real numbers (Pearson coefficient of two real vectors) as a MetricValue.
    PredictiveAccuracy
    Currently, two default metrics inherited from DefaultMetric class are TimeMetric class and Accuracy class.
    TimeMetric
    Currently, two default metrics inherited from DefaultMetric class are TimeMetric class and Accuracy class.
    TwoArrayMetricValue
    This abstract class represents two arrays of real numbers as a MetricValue.
